Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: *In Komodo, which is a system very similar to Delegated Proof of Stake, the Notary nodes automatically put their OP_RETURN proofs into the Bitcoin blockchain just by the virtue of existing. These nodes get their rewards by securing the DPoS system. New coins can join DPoW only by requesting the developers, who then add the coin to the protection umbrella. Interestingly, the Notary nodes (users) have no say in this.*

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: The point of notarizations is not to just notarize for the sake of it... in that case the notary network would not be needed

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: The point of the notarizations is to be able to use them in benefit of other coins, to make users safe by letting the coin clients know which way to look if something is wrong

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: If there are no hard coded pubkeys jn the code, what stops someone from making a farm that is significant enough to notarjze the wrong forks?
